str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
A verbal defense (particularly in a law court). From the same as apologeomai; a plea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
